items.sentence: Do you have any idea why Tom went to Boston?
Do you have any interesting stories to tell?
Do you think I really want to be doing this?
Do you think Tom could be telling the truth?
Do you think Tom really knows what happened?
Do you think Tom taught Mary how to do that?
Do you think Tom will allow Mary to do that?
Do you think doing that is going to be easy?
Tom can\'t afford to buy Mary anything nice.
Give me one reason why I shouldn\'t do that.
All I ever wanted was to just be left alone.
Are you blaming me for your lack of success?
Both Tom and Mary were wearing trench coats.
What\'s Tom planning to do after he retires?
What\'s going to happen here this afternoon?
What\'s going to happen to all these people?
What\'s in the box is none of your business.
What\'s the best way to resolve the problem?
When it stops raining, let\'s go for a walk.
Tom doesn\'t look very much like his father.
Tom doesn\'t remember if he locked the door.
Tom doesn\'t seem to know much about Boston.
I appreciate everything Tom has done for us.
I appreciate your taking the time to see me.
I was absent from school because of illness.
I was disappointed to hear the test results.
I was the only one not invited to the party.
Tom thought that Mary wouldn\'t forgive him.
Tom thought that Mary wouldn\'t like Boston.
Tom probably won\'t be back by October 20th.
Tom probably won\'t have to do that anymore.
Where did you learn to speak French so well?
Who else do you want to invite to the party?
Tom joined the navy after finishing college.
Tom lied to us about how much money he made.
Tom lied when Mary asked him how old he was.
Tom and Mary looked into each other\'s eyes.
Don\'t you just love it when people do that?
Tom pushed the down button for the elevator.
Tom saw three young boys looking at his car.
I don\'t really want to go fishing with Tom.
I can\'t be away from my wife for that long.
I can\'t believe you really want to do that.
I can\'t decide what to eat for lunch today.
I can\'t even make a peanut butter sandwich.

Do you really think Tom wouldn\'t like this?
Do you really think that I\'m that gullible?

Are there any problems we should know about?
Are we really going to do this every Monday?
Are you and Tom coming to the party tonight?
Tom is having trouble making both ends meet.
Tom is much more fluent in French than I am.
Do you know anything about fixing computers?
Tom said that he\'d be back on October 20th.
Tom says he doesn\'t know much about Boston.
I\'ve known Tom longer than I\'ve known you.
I won\'t be able to do that until next week.
I wonder why Tom didn\'t show up last night.
I wonder why Tom didn\'t tell me to do that.
I wonder why we haven\'t heard from Tom yet.
It\'s strange that our friends aren\'t here.
I didn\'t want to do this, but Tom insisted.
I don\'t care what it cost. I still want it.
I don\'t have anything I need to say to Tom.
I don\'t think Tom is as stupid as he looks.
I already said I don\'t know how to do that.
I already spoke to someone in Tom\'s office.
Tom and Mary aren\'t speaking to each other.
You\'re not under any obligation to do that.
That\'s a question that I hear all the time.
Tom can\'t see anything without his glasses.
Tom didn\'t think he was committing a crime.
Tom didn\'t think he was violating any laws.
I met Tom at a wine auction a few years ago.
I missed you a lot while you were in Boston.

I need that information as soon as possible.
I need to find another way to earn a living.

Please be careful not to overexert yourself.
She worships him and the ground he walks on.
It\'s been a long time since I\'ve seen Tom.
That company is managed by my older brother.

We don\'t have a choice. We have to do this.

I\'m not mad at you. I\'m just disappointed.
